Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw a specific land habitat, such as a forest or desert, and include a variety of living things like trees, grasses, lizards, ants, and possibly other animals like birds or mammals.

The student can accurately draw a specific water habitat, such as a pond or ocean, incorporating a variety of living things found there such as fish, clams, aquatic plants, and perhaps other creatures like crustaceans or seaweed.
The student can label or depict patterns showing both similarities and differences among living things in different habitats, demonstrating clear understanding.
The student can effectively use the drawing to compare and contrast plant and animal diversity between a land habitat and a water habitat, providing visual evidence to support this comparison.
The student can visually present evidence of their observations, showing a comprehensive and well-organized depiction of the diversity of life across the depicted habitats.
CANNOT: The student may have minor gaps or may not label every detail, but these are minimal and do not significantly detract from their overall understanding and depiction.
At this advanced level, the student is unlikely to display any major misunderstandings or incorrect depictions of habitat interactions.
